title: I live in California and I have a judgement against me from CACH LLC and was never served papers. I called the courts and the
question: lady stated that the judgement was served to my daughter which at the time was 15. How can I fight this judgement I dont know who they are and was never served with papers
question_tags: LLC (limited liability company),Bankruptcy,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Lawsuits and disputes,Default judgment
answers: Counsel's are correct, you may have grounds to file a motion to set aside the default judgement. Feel free to contact our offices for a free consultation on your rights - 619 233 7770.

Ms. Bennett, Mr. Kopelson, and Mr. Chen have each given good tips for you on this debt. Please read my blog posting for the full array of your options when the defendant first learns of a default judgement on an unpaid debt, below.

Time is the key, as there is case law that requires the defendant to file the motion to set aside promptly, upon learning of a default judgment that was filed without valid service. Calling the attorney for the Plaintiff can be used to show when you first learned of this default judgment, so moving forward after that is key. Be so, so careful what you say to the attorney, as there is a risk that they attorney or their collection agents may misrepresent what you said on the phone to them. I have seen that and sometimes the judge does not know whom to believe. There is no standard form to set aside a default judgment, which is why you should hire an attorney to do this for you, as you may only get one shot.

Robert Stempler (please see DISCLAIMER below)
www.StopCollectionLawsuits.com
www.facebook.com/SoCalConsumerLawyer
Twitter: @RStempler

If there is a judgment, the judgment will have the name of the court and the court branch as well as the case number. You (or your attorney) will need to file a motion to set aside the default and to vacate default judgment if the plaintiff is not willing to stipulate to set aside the default.

You may have grounds to set aside the default judgment. You should contact a lawyer as soon as possible because there are time limits for setting aside judgments in some cases. CACH, LLC is a company that purchases credit card debts and sues to collect them.
Go to court nad get copies of everything in the court file immediately. Then set appt with a collection defense atty to review the papers.
